author: Nick Timiraos
title: Fed’s Barkin: Economy No Longer Needs Stimulative Interest-Rate Stance
text:
FAIRFAX, Va.—Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Thomas Barkin said Monday it would be hard to justify interest-rate policy that stimulates growth when the economy is expanding solidly, unemployment is low and inflation is stable.
“Monetary policy is still pretty accommodative,” Mr. Barkin said in his first public appearance since becoming the Richmond Fed’s leader. “It’s hard to argue accommodation is appropriate when unemployment is low and inflation is effectively at our target.”
...
